entry.title: Across Every State Line
entry.summary:
Author: velvet_alchemist

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,636Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 47

Summary: You’re on the way back from a mission with your partners. Well, you thought they were just business partners. Turns out you could be in for a hell of a lot more… and tension is building with every brush of the fingertips and each longing glance.   Pfft, absolute Batman who? This is absolute Pound-town.

entry.title: red flags, red hood
entry.summary:
Author: whimsicalblinkers

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,667Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: A journalist in a crummy city known as Gotham is dragged to the Iceberg Lounge with her friend, who clearly has better social skills than her. After being introduced to her friend's potential hookup of the night, she's also introduced to Jason Todd. She immediately finds him annoying. Too gruff, too tense. Too... everything. She's not afraid to make it known. But he becomes a pesky thorn in her side once her friend gets involved with Dick Grayson, and her dislike for him only grows. What a red flag.

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,774Chapters: 12/15Kudos: 532

Summary: You weren’t looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn’t looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn’t ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier—something that almost feels like home.

entry.title: we're all reaching out to find another hand
entry.summary:
Author: soter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 52,542Chapters: 11/18Kudos: 167

Summary: “I know you’re a meta,” you blurt. Jason stares. “What.” “I saw your hand—I saw the cut and the blood, but then, it was healed, somehow, right, and like, I know I wasn’t supposed to see that and then I felt really bad about it and I wanted to let you know that I know but I didn’t want you to think I was going to, like, blackmail you—” “Blackmail me?” “Of course not,” you quickly say. “Never. No. That’s horrible. Can you imagine what would happen if it got out?” You wince. “Sorry, stupid question, you probably have.”or in which you discover that your neighbor, Jason Todd, is a metahuman, try to compensate, and things get a little... weird.

entry.title: The Birthday Party
entry.summary:
Author: Ava_Mae

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,205Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 82

Summary: "C'mon Alex, you need to work with me here," you tried to gently coax him. You didn't want to fully wake him up if you could avoid it, but you weren't sure how else you were gonna get him back down to the apartment.  "I can carry him," Jay offered, setting the telescope case down on the ground.  You glanced up, surprised. "What? No, it's okay, I've got him." "Seriously, sweetheart, it's not a problem." You looked back at Alex, who was barely staying on his feet, and remembered how it was nearly impossible for you to carry him anymore, even though he was a little small for his age. "...okay," you relented. "If you're sure." "I've carried Nightwing before, Alex is nothing." Jay grinned, then crouched down next to your son. "C'mere buddy."
